alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 23 at 3:03AM MST until December 25 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Periods of heavy snow showers expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches, but locally 24 to 30 inches over higher mountains through Saturday. Winds will be strong enough to cause blowing snow and significantly reduce visibilities at times. * WHERE...Boise Mountains zone. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult to impossible.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means there will be snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Significant amounts of snow are forecast that will make travel dangerous. Only travel in an emergency. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
